name: fertilising, by rig fertiliser, sugarcane | fertilising, by rig fertiliser, sugarcane | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19845/documentation

This dataset represents the fertilising operation in one hectare (ha). This operation is related to one hectare of the cultural treatments used for the sugarcane culture. Functional Unit (FU) is one hectare of fertiliser application. The operation time is about  2.08  hours per ha (50% of this time is actually worked, discounting time for maintenance, waiting in the field and re-allocations between the plots).

From agricultural field foreseen to be processed.

This activity ends with fertilser are applied on the field. The dataset includes the diesel fuel consumption (12.33 L diesel per hour of effective operation) and the amount of agricultural machinery and shed. Also taken into consideration is the amount of emissions to the air from diesel combustion and the emission to the soil from tyre abrasion during the work process.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Most of the data used to modelling this activity were collected in the last few years (2012-2014).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The global dataset is modeled based on information from sugarcane production system in Brazilian South-Cental region.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This activity is performed with a tractor (power 125 hp; weight 4780 kg) plus a fertilizer broadcaster (weight 850 kg). Life spam of the tractor is considered as 11750 operating hours and of the implement as 10000 operating hours. Machinery used, fuel consumption and operation efficiencies were based on data from sugarcane mills in Brazil, expert's informations and unpublished data.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolated from Brazilian data, uncertainty adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The main source of data for agricultural inputs and operations modelling procedures is detailed in Cavalett et al., 2016. Emissions from the agricultural process are estimated according to Nemecek and Kagi, 2007.

flow.name: fertilising, by rig fertiliser, sugarcane
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production
